clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Effectiveness of Abatacept in Psoriatic Arthritis Participants
clinical_study.official_title: Abatacept - Long-Term Real-Life Experience in Psoriatic Arthritis (PsA) in Germany: an Observational Study (ALTEA)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a long-term, observational study of Abatacept in patients with Psoriatic Arthritis, a chronic inflammatory disorder.

primary_outcome.measure: Disease Activity index for PSoriatic Arthritis (DAPSA)
primary_outcome.description: Disease Activity index for PSoriatic Arthritis (DAPSA) equals number of tender joints (0-68) plus number of swollen joints (0-66) plus C-reactive protein (mg/dl) plus participant's disease activity level (0 not active-10 very active) plus participant's joint pain level (0 no pain-10 very severe)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of adverse events per participants
Skin involvement under abatacept therapy as assessed by Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI)
secondary_outcome.description: The PASI score consists of 4 items that are assessed (surface area, severity of erythema [redness], induration [thickness], and desquamation [scale]), evaluated for 4 body areas (head, trunk, and upper and lower extremities).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of reasons for stopping or switching therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Including patient/physician treatment satisfaction and compliance

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants using abatacept monotherapy

secondary_outcome.description: Retention rate over the 12-month observation period calculated as the proportion of patients continuing with abatacept treatment at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of serious adverse events per participants
Number of participants using abatacept combination therapy
Participant's quality of life as assessed by the Eular Psoriatic Arthritis Impact of Disease; PSAID12 For Clinical Practice
Distribution of socio-demographic characteristics in PsA patients at abatacept therapy initiation using descriptive statistics
Distribution of medical history in PsA patients at abatacept therapy initiation using descriptive statistics
Distribution of disease history in PsA patients at abatacept therapy initiation using descriptive statistics
Distribution of comorbidities in PsA patients at abatacept therapy initiation using descriptive statistics
Distribution of clinical measures in PsA patients at abatacept therapy initiation using descriptive statistics
Skin involvement under abatacept therapy as assessed by body surface area (BSA)
secondary_outcome.description: BSA considers the surface area of the patient's handprint (palm and fingers) as representing 1% of the body's surface area that is affected. The BSA is also assessed by the phycisian.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Biologic-naive adults initiating abatacept for PsA
arm_group.description: Adult patients, naïve of abatacept and any other biologic agent, initiating abatacept for PsA, under usual practice conditions

arm_group.arm_group_label: Adults initiating abatacept for PsA after one failed TNFi
arm_group.description: Adult patients, naïve of abatacept, who previously failed one tumor necrosis factor inhibitor (TNFi), initiating abatacept for PsA, under usual practice conditions

intervention.arm_group_label: Biologic-naive adults initiating abatacept for PsA
Adults initiating abatacept for PsA after one failed TNFi

study_pop.textblock: The patient population targeted by the study consists of patients with PsA that initiate treatment with abatacept

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients 18 years of age at enrollment
- Patients who signed an informed consent
- Patients diagnosed with PsA as per the criteria of the Classification of Psoriatic Arthritis (CASPAR) Study Group17
- Patients naïve of abatacept and who at their physician's discretion initiate abatacept
- Patients meeting criteria for abatacept treatment for PsA as specified in the German label
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are currently included in any interventional clinical trial in PsA/RA
Other protocol defined criteria inclusion/exclusion criteria could apply
